title: Powers conferred by an adjuster's license
context: ยง431:9-226 Powers conferred by an adjuster&rsquo;s license. (a) An adjuster has authority under the adjuster&rsquo;s license only to investigate for, report to, or adjust for the adjuster&rsquo;s principal only on behalf of the insurers if licensed as an independent adjuster, or only on behalf of insureds if licensed as a public adjuster. (b) An adjuster licensed concurrently as both an independent and a public adjuster is not permitted to represent both the insurer and the insured in the same transaction. [L 1987, c 347, pt of ยง2]
